text: Bottled (backlog). Hazy orange colour, small white head. Aroma is grass, earth, some bready malts as well as some slight herbal notes. Flavour is very similar, with a nice floral and sweet malty touch to it.

375 ml bottle. Pours hazy golden, slight head that rapidly disappears,slight lacing. Aroma is of yeast, lemon, straw. Taste is of the above, plus biscuity sweetness with bitterness/carbonation lingering at back and sides of mouth. Mouthfeel is light-bodied. Super-clean finish; refreshing and clean. A kick-ass, step-up lawnmower beer.
Líquido opaco, bastante encorpada. Aroma não muito forte. Bem carregada no lúpulo. Muito boa.

Almost opaque veiled brown caramel color with lots of fizzy glass clinging activity. Thick creamy and foamy beige 3 finger island head, lasting around 10 to 15 minutes, with a good amount of legs.

Aromas of grass, fresh flowers, and caramel. Flavors of lemony citrus with noble spices. Hints of flowers and nuts. Highly bitter with a strong sharpness and faint sweetness. Very tasty and fully flavored.

Oily full body with a fresh perfect dose of champagne like carbonation. Strong and long finish, ending with lingering noble spices, a grassy tongue coat, and faint salivating sweetness with a floral touch.

Overall excellent quality craft. Delicious flavors, well balanced, and complex. One of the most incredible grassy feel Ive ever tasted. High bitterness but still enjoyable and fresh with a nice zest, like a witbier pilsner. A little boozy, slight vinous, but still minimal.

Look: orange hazy.

Aroma: fruity, malty, sweet.
Taste: sweet, light sourness, light spicy bitterness.
Flavour: dried apples, rotten fruits.
Finish is fruity and spicy, slightly ethery.

Good.

Shared bottle. Cloudy orange, off-white how. Strong caramel flower aroma, a touch of clovy/gluey spice. Dry spicy, light caramel malts behind. Enough grassy bitterness with a touch of lagerish harshness. Very smooth mouthfeel. Very good.
Bouteille 33 cl - couleur dorée trouble, odeur et goût citronnés, amertume prononcée, dépôt en fond de verre, globalement pas terrible

The Sampler, brooklyn bottle: pours hazy orange with a white head. Aroma is light grass, grain, malt. Taste is sweet and bready with subdued hops. No off taste. Nice aftertaste. Good body and character.
Citronnée? Amère? Pas sûre entre les deux, mais petit goût désagréable.....

Robust notes of orange, flowers, grass, light honey and cereal from this slightly cloudy straw coloured brew. The energetic carbonation carries forth quite well these aromas as matching flavours. Although no pundit when it comes to the style, this particular offering is very Pilsneresque and evokes similar sentiments, perhaps just heightened. Overall it is a nice relaxing venture into a new (to me) style.

Robe blonde légèrement trouble, col de mousse généreux, moyennant dense et tenace. Dentelle collante. Arômes de malt pils, gros grains frais, eau citronnée, gazon, conifères. En bouche, encore une fois bien malté. Saveurs amères de citron et dherbe. Pointes de houblons nobles et poivre concassé. Texture légère, corps bien rond par contre. Pétillement moyen mais agréable. Pas mon genre mais se boit bien.
Dorada turbia de abundante espuma cremosa y aroma malteado con notas de pino. Continua en boca, bebible y agradable, para acabar en un final seco. Buena.
Clearly Canadians dont know how to make a good Kellerbier; they should leave this to the Germans. Sampled at World of Beer Fest.

La robe dorée est surtout embrouillée, mais il est clair quelle voudrait tellement être ... claire justement. Une mousse blanche dépaisseur moyenne éclaircit le tout. Des céréales fraîches et des houblons herbacés constituent un bouquet simple, mais invitant. Cette fraîcheur céréalière se répète en bouche, celle étant supportée par une amertume toute timide gracieuseté des houblons nobles allemands. Une bière de soif sans précédent et la meilleure représentation du style en sol québécois.

Cor de mel, límpida. Espuma abundante de média duração. Aroma de malte, um pouco floral e cítrico. Sabor amargo, citrico, com notas de citronela e folhas verdes. Retrogosto amargo, equilibrado com um pouco de adocicado.
Bottle. Hazy yellow in color with a steady white head. Cereal, garden fruits and bit of green herbal notes in aroma. Biscuits, bit of hay and malts in taste. Quite crisp and refreshing. Good one.
Couleur dorée tranlucide avec un col blanc résistant. Aromes de céréales sucré, un peu de caramel, herbe. Rien dimpressionnant mais une bière respectable!
The taste could be better. Aroma is OK and appearance too. Overall 3.. Estevao Alvarenga

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2015 Update: 341ml bottle bought directly at the brewery, thanks Guillaume. Aroma: floral, German yeast, grass and pine nuts. App: clear light golden with small white head and some lacing. Taste and palate: medium body, average carbonation, light sweetness, light bitter finish. Overall: a really good beer for this style but far from my favorite style. Really easy to drink. This second bottle of way better than my first one that smelled skunk a bit, probably a light age issue.

Brown bottle, 750 ml, trade with Alex Ganivet-Boileau (merci!), savoured on December 18 2014; eye: golden, clear, light effervescence, good sheet of white head, light lacing; nose: floral hops, malt, light sulfur, slight caramel, herbaceous; mouth: herbaceous, light sulfur, floral hops, slight caramel, malt, quite carbonated finale in malt with light acrid presence, medium body, quite carbonated, mildly bitter, slightly sweet, fizzy texture; overall: correct

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 750 ml, 5,5 %, échange avec Alex Ganivet-Boileau (merci!), savourée le 18 décembre 2014; il : dorée, limpide, légère effervescence, bonne couverture de mousse blanche, légère dentelle; nez : houblon floral, malt, léger soufre, très léger caramel, herbacé; bouche : herbacé, léger soufre, houblon floral, très léger caramel, malt, finale très carbonatée en malt avec légère présence dâcreté, corps moyen, très carbonatée, moyennement amère, très légèrement sucrée, texture pétillante; en résumé : correct
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is fruit, malt, grass. Flavour is fruit, malt, grass, yeast. Medium body. Ordinary beer.
750ml bottle pours a pale straw color with a lot of frothy head. Great balance of hops and malt. Complex flavor for this style.

Bottle 375ml. [ As Les Trois Mousquetaires S.S. Kellerbier ].Clear medium yellow color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, fruity, moderate hoppy, grass - green grass. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, grain, fruity, grass, green grass. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20140705]
Bottle. Hazy, golden, frothy, white foam, medium bitterness, medium body, sticky, soft carbonation, & bitter finish.
cask. Hazy-yellow pour. Fresh flavours of citrus and grasses. Very refreshing.

Bière jaune paille, bien voilée avec quelques toute petites particules visibles en suspension, effervescence moyenne, et surmontée dun col blanc pas tellement large, mais bien dense, mousseux, persistant et collant. Arômes de grain frais, dagrumes (citron surtout), dherbes aromatiques (menthe surtout) et de houblon plutôt végétal (feuilles, branches) aux notes quelque peu terreuses et poivrées. Beau nez bien agréable, très intense, belle complexité. En bouche, pétillement plutôt élevé au palais, mais onctuosité plutôt faible quoique cest tout de même légèrement huileux au palais. Au goût, entrée en bouche bien malté de pain frais, grain et léger sucre dorge, suivi dun houblon dominant aux saveurs principalement dagrume (surtout citron) et dherbes aromatiques (menthe surtout) et notes végétales, terreuses et poivrées. Amertume modérément élevée. Bière très intense, très bel équilibre malt/houblon, très bonne intégration des différentes saveurs entre elles, complexité adéquate. Très bonne bière!

Bottle. Pours hazy golden butterscotch, medium creamy off-white head, dissipates slowly, nice lacing. Aroma is grain, corn, hay, grass. Flavor is light sweet and light plus bitter, clean. Light body, high carbonation. Pretty solid as a drinker. No idea why they would bottle this in 750s though.
Keg at SBWF.  Hazy golden, small head. Mid dry with medium body and clean, rounded mouthfeel, Grass and dough, butter and grains join later. Mid bitter finish.

Bouteille de 341ml achetée chez IGA. Couleur jaune/paille avec une mousse savonneuse de classe mondiale. Elle semble rester collée sur les parois du verre indéfiniment, cest très beau. Arôme un peu faible, difficile à percevoir de gazon, savon. Cependant au goût cest tout le contraire, explosion de saveur, beaucoup dherbes fraiches, poivres, savon, pamplemousse. Palais medium avec effervescence très élevé. Cest ma première Kellerbier, et à laveugle jaurais probablement identifié une IPA tellement la présence de houblon se fait sentir. Très bon produit pour le prix.
Tap at biermarkt.pours golden tons of head and lots of lacing. Nose is cereal. Flavours of fruit, cereal and yeast. Taste light sweet light bitter. Full body lively carbonation.

On tap at Bier Markt Montreal. A clear gold virtually identical to the Dominus Triple. It has a very fresh floral aroma of jasmine, imagine running through a green field of wildflowers. Soft mouthfeel medium bodied. The taste is floral, sweet light malts, a bit of cracker then a green bitterness.

This beer has it going on. Pours a cloudy gold with lots of creamy head, great lacing. Nose is bready malt, spice, and pine. Taste follows with a great lingering dry finish. Another solid offering from these guys
Slight sour aroma with a cloudy gold appearance. Classic lager character with the hop bitterness. Bitterness lingers.
Poured from a bottle. I like the appearance -- 2 finger head, orange cloudy appearance, decent lacing. Understated citrusy aroma, clean taste, slightly bitter.
Not much of an aroma, cloudy yellow color not much head. Chalky feel with a mild taste of hops. Dry finish with a mildly bitter hop finish.

Poured from a bottle. Clear yellow color, small white head. Mild aroma. Medium body with a mild sweet flavor and a medium finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a hazy yellow with a lovely creamy head with long retention. Aroma is malty, hints of grassy and hoppy notes. Body is a little on the sour and dry side. Hoppy taste with a slightly dry aftertaste. Generally balanced and very drinkable.
Color dorado turbio, espuma blanca ligera. Aromas de malta, herbáles y cítricos. Cuerpo ligero, con sabores cítricos y herbales, amargor moderado pero seco al final. Bien
Unclear yellow of color with a white head. An aroma of sweet malt, citrus, herbs and peaches. A flavor of hops, citrus, hay and cereal.
Bottle, 5.5%. Clear golden with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, grainy, hop and grass. Flavour is malt, fruit, hop, grass, little grainy, little sweet and bitter.

Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Clear golden with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, light yeasty and moderate hoppy - grass. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 050714
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are malt, grass, straw, hops and has a sweet malty finish.

Bottle. Pours cloudy golden with a white head. 
Smells mostly of bread. Tastes doughy too with a certain sweetness. A nice and light, flavourful quaff. 
2014-06-01

341ml bottle @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo.26-01-2014.
In short: a poor keller.
Pours quite clear bright gold with nice white head, creamy. Poor head retention, some lacing. Fruity, some berries, buttery and grassy aromas (all i can get with some persistent cold...). Light to medium body, avverage carbonation, some crispy to viscous texture. Taste is fruity, some grapy, some smooth palate, some diacetils. Mild bitter, dry aftertaste. Nothing remarkable, far from original german kellers.

Appearance: Pours a clouded, darkish golden-orange body with a tall, sustained, meringue-like, white head. Thick lacing.

Smell: Toasted grains with an ultra thin edge of sugar, fresh, yeasty dough, a clean, spicy, bitter herb hop aroma, with an underlying growing fruitiness.

Taste: Subtly toasty, lightly doughy maltiness with a light touch of honey sweetness. Spicy, lightly herbal (a tad grassy) hops with a thin bit of lemony citrus. Medium-light bitterness. A bit of sour yeast character. Drying, herbal-laden finish with touches of yeast and minerality. 

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. High, tingly carbonation.

Overall: A very pronounced level of carbonation, but, still, its a rather refreshing brew.
bottle purchased from fridge in quebec, though not sure of freshness. doughy biscuity malts. soft herbal dull hop character. malt character somewhat dull and muted. okay, somewhat unmemorable beer.

[From my backlog, tasted @ El Lúpulo Feroz]. Pale golden color with a white head, medium duration and good lacework. Aroma has notes of hay and some citrusy traces. Flavor is slightly bittery, fresh hops and light citrus notes. The final is light bittery with a dry mouthfeel.
Une lager de qualité qui est une bonne alternative au lager commerciale du Québec. On sent la qualité des ingrédients utilisés dans sa simplicité. Bonne bière de terrase un après-midi dété.

Bottle from Bierkompass,de, bought in March 2014. 

Clear golden with a large white head. Aroma of hops, grass, grain and citrus. Taste of hops, grain, citrus, grass and some light yeast. The finish was dry and bitter.

Bouteille de 750 ml. Dégustée le 10 février 2013. Bière blonde dorée. Mousse beaucoup, col très épais blanc, persistant. Très effervescente, bulles fines à moyennes. Odeur de houblon, de savon, de céréales. Assez forte en amorce, peu sucrée, peu amère. Saveur un peu citronnée, un peu âcre en amorce, de pin. Unidimensionnelle, un peu résineuse, finale assez sèche.

Botella de 375ml. Vaso Weizen. aromas de malta dulce y miel al destapar. Color dorado y transparente. Espuma blanca que deja fina y persistente capa en la superficie y copos en las paredes. Aromas ligeros de madera, grano y malta. Entrada chispeante con un leve sabor cítrico y amargor ascendente redondeado por trazos de madera verde y algo de pino. Cuerpo ligero y carbonatación suave. Paladar denso con toque especiado; la efervescencia es suave y no hay sensación aguada. Notas herbales leves y de miel junto a un limpio amargor, que permite percibir las maltas caramelo, dan paso a un final seco amargo/dulce. Refrescante y de asimilación agradable. 
375ml bottle. Weizen glass. - sweet malt & honey aromas fly at the moment cap is removed. Golden color, crystal clear appearance. White froth, foamy & lasting thin layer on top, spots are left on sides. Slightly woody, grainy & malty aromas. Crispy upfront, light citric flavor & arising bitterness rounded by green wood & light piney hues. Light body. Soft carbonation. Dense palate & spicy touch, gentle effervescence but no watery sensation. Low herbal, honey notes & clean bitterness allowing caramel be shown- resolve in a dry bitter/sweet finish. Refreshing & nice drinkability !!

375 mL bottle. Pours lightly hazed gold with a thin white cap. Mild grain and straw on the nose with noble hop earth or perfume and a touch of mineral. Subtle biscuit sweetness with a hint of hop bite. Moderate plus carbonation and a clean mouth feel. Light lager with flavor; bless us all!

375ml bottle. Minimally hazy golden colour with average to huge, fluffy, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Strawy aroma, minimally grainy, a touch of grassy hop and lemon. Taste is dry, strawy, grainy, lasting bitter hoppy, strawy finish. Average.

Amarilla, muy pálida. Con una buena capa de sedosa espuma blanca de buena retención.
Aroma suave a malta y grano, con algo de levadura.
Cuerpo ligero y bien carbonatada.
En boca ligeramente amarga, con presencia del cereal y hierba. 
Refrescante y sabrosa, para beberla por litros.

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein leicht trübes goldenes Bier mit schöner stabilen Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig fruchtig, blumig, leicht nach Honig. Geschmack süß fruchtig, dann bitter werdend, Citrus, hopfig malzig.

A great Keller, respecting the traditional keys of the style without being old-fashioned. Rustic, very yeasty, sometimes evoke a lager version of a saison. Great body for such little alcohol. Refreshing, tasty, drinkable, it has all you can ask for from a beer. Loved it, a little masterpiece.

Beau visuel, belles bulles sur fond doté troublé par la levure.
jaime le nez...ça sent bon le houblon allemand...
la bouche est amère...trop amère...ça manque déquilibre pour moi
mais elle a du corps...
Cette Keller est autre produit des 3M sans défauts graves!
allez jen essai une autre!
Bien florale, effervescente, excellente bref. Je ne suis pas habitué à ce style mais il faut une première fois ça a lair ;-)

Very nice kellerbier. Pours orange with decent rad and lacing. Nice light citrud hops and sharp malt profile. A little buttery, but comes together ok. Finishes with light bitterness. Bottle from Bieres du monde.

Pours a cloudy copper with a long lasting small dense white head that laces the glass quite nicely. Aroma is crisp pilsner malt, earthy and grassy hops, and faint woody notes. Flavour is crisp pilsner malts, grassy, spicy hops, earthy, moderate hop bitterness and faint wood like notes. Interesting beer, need to do more "research"(drink more) of this style...

Olfactif: On y retrouve les bons accents de grains et de céréales typiques des lagers allemandes. De petites notes de terre et de viande viennent sajouter. Nez assez typique , de puissance moyenne avec un bon maintient. 
Visuel: Blonde / dorée, assez claire, avec une bonne mousse rocailleuse, assez épaisse et persistante. Elle laisse une petite dentelle discrète sur les parois du verre. 
Gustatif: Lattaque est sèche, tout en grains et en céréales avec de surprenantes notes de pommes de terre. Présence daccents terreux, de foin. Lamertume est bien présente en finale, laissant une trace de terre sèche. Les flaveurs de céréales sont très distinctes et très bien réussies. En bouche, sa texture est moyenne et elle allie complexité subtile daccents céréaliers à une amertume sèche et terreuse. Une bière très typée; un exemple très réussi de bonne lager. Ne plaira pas à tous, mais demeure un exemple du style. 
Note: Cette bière peut savérer instable aux conditions dentreposage. Ceci est ma deuxième évaluation, car la première bouteille présentait des défauts majeurs mis au doute par une effervescence extrême et une forte odeur dalcool en olfactif. Toutes les notes citées plus haut étaient exagérées à la limite du désagréable. La deuxième bouteille était cependant excellente.

Aroma is really interesting, earthy, herby, almost like Dr. Pepper in there. But also bright. Appearance is nice, very clear pale gold with long-lasting head and lacing. The taste experience is dominated by the finish, so Il mention that first. Its kind of bitter but also floral/perfumey as well. Getting back to the start its actually very malty with some fruitiness. That bitterness is also there as well. Feel is great, not too light but also complex. Kind of tingly in places but bitter as well. This is a very well-balanced and complex little beer.

375ml bottle. Pours hazy light amber with a nice foamy hazel head. Sweet caramel aroma up front followed by fresh grains, grass and clean hops. Taste is sweet, earthy and bready with light sour and mineral notes. Smooth and bitter finish.
Average head, orange, hazy body. Aroma is hoppy, herbs, resin, citrus. Body is light, metallic texture. Balanced finish. Taste is fruity, bitter, spicy.

750 ml bottle @ RIP camp.
Pours a golden colour with a white foamy. Aroma of grassy hops, sweet honey and spruce. Flavour of strong prominent noble hops, grainy malts, pine, some fruity sweetness, . Medium bodied, smooth mouthfeel and a dry, very bitter, grassy finish. Definitely quite unique, as this is so sweet and fruity but also very bitter.

750ml bottle @ RIP Camp
Bottled 03/2013 - 
Pours golden with a large foamy head. Aroma of earthy notes, grassy hops, bready malts, yeast and spices. Taste is smooth, hoppy and earthy with notes of grass, bready malts and yeast. Finish is sweetish, smooth and fruity with hints of grass and maltiness. Nice, quite fruity kellerbier.

75 cl bottle @ RIP Camp.
Pours hazy golden color with a large white head. Aroma of grass, grain, some faint vegetables, hops and pale malts. Flavor of grass, butter, bread, malts, wooden notes and some hops. Quite malty and somewhat stuffy, not your typical kellerbier, decent anyway.
3314

75 cl bottle @ RIP camp, produced 03/2013
Aroma is musty with some fruity and floury notes. Also some gooseberry bush leaves. Flavour is fruity with apricot, bush leaves and herbs. Also hints of fruit candy. Closer to a Belgian ale than kellerbier.

Bouteille 75cl partagée avec Tomaz, bottled on 03/2013.
Couleur orangée, col blanc fin.
Arôme présente un bouquet très allemand qui est superbement plaisant et rappelle fort le style allemand. Sympa pour une québecoise qui pour moi supplante bcp dallemandes du même style.
Note rappelant le maïs, fleuri et houblonné, légère pointe de pin et citronné. Cara-pâle avec ce rendu de feuilles vertes citronnier en retrait. Le tout est ponctué par un agréable côté grains.
Palais est malté, carapils malt type européen. Amertume moyenne citronnée et fleurie surtout en fin de bouche avec un profil houblonné noble neutre. Garde une certaine douceur de grains qui est fort agréable. Belle rondeur maltée, caramel avec encore ici un rappel qu style allemand classique mais amélioré&.

Bottle, bought @ Beer City, Belgium. Pours clear, golden with a medium, frothy, white head. Aroma has grass, citrus, crisp malts. Medium carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has good crisp malts, citrus, seriously grassy. Quite bitter finish. Lovely.

Cloudy pilsner-beautiful smooth rich taste but still retains the freshness of a classic pilsner-the best of both worlds. Cracker of a cleansing ale with something else that takes it to the next level.

Wow, what a hot day in central Texas... I could really use a lager right now, even if it is from Quebec! Bright golden orange in color, mostly clear with a full, billowy, frothy bright white head... The thick carbonation really sustains this head. Its never ending! It has a classic lager aroma, but pleasant, grainy, slightly fruity, with a touch of what seems like a little bacteria or yeasty sourness. Some slight caramel sweetness also comes through in the nose. The flavor is absolutely nothing like what I expected, with a very bitter, grainy character that defies what youd normally expect of a lager. Its closer to a bitter pilsener, really, but with some crystal malts in play. Its finish is bitter, with light malt backing. Nice, and very different. Fresh, clean pilsener grains leave an effect in the mouth that reminds you that barley is fermentable.
Not what I expected... heaps of cereal and hops. earthy. long, mouth watering palate. makes me hungry...
375ml. Blonde, dorée, houblon, domestique, fruité, pêches en canne, herbacé, malt, céréales, noix. Bouche: céréale, fine amertume, pêche, malt, noix, amande, florale, finale amère. Bien fait.
Smells grassy and nutty. Drinks much the same but gladly these tastes are not to overwealming. Well done.

Production date 07/2012. Pours a hazy amber colour with a frothy off-white head, great retention and a little lace patch up here and there. Sweet malty nose with dark fruits (plums, dates), rusty water (from the hop), grain and maple. Thankfully, not as sweet in the mouth with some caramel malts, fruits balanced by some slight grassy bitterness from the hop. Hints of nuts and coffee follow. Quite a nice take on the Kellerbier with a little more hop to it.

Medium gold, faint haze, OK head.  Light cereal and faint fruit apricot, touch floral aroma.  Flavor is grain, followed by a faintly fruity and floral finish.  More like an ale than a lager, but tasty enough when thinking "blonde ale."

375ml bottle. A slightly hazy golden body, big white head with good retention and lacing. Light and fresh aroma: German herbal hops, fresh cut grass, cereals, a touch of bread and spices. Taste of malt, decent amount of herbal bitter hops, rye bread, slightly citrusy. Almost chewy.

Appearance: Clear golden with a smal white head that leaves some lacing. 
Aroma: Grass, hay, vegetal matters over a discrete bready aroma. 
Taste: Medium sweet with a firm bitterness, full of earthy and noble hops. Id argue that it is a bit harsh too, but not by much.
Overall: A clean and enjoyable lager. No off flavors were detected.

Bière blonde foncée de 5.5 % dalcool. Elle possède un moyen col mousseux au versement. Elle possède un odorat sucré et une seconde odeur plus céréalière, du style sarrasin. Elle possède un goût et un arrière-goût très amer, comme un goût de lime. Je ne détecte rien dautre.

À loeil :
Bière brun clair très trouble et garnie dune bonne mousse qui habille le verre mais sestompe à la surface.
Au nez :
Notes herbacées, fraîches et de conifère. Nez subtil mais habile.
Au goût :
Lhoublon entre en premier avec des résines de conifères qui séquilibre dans une finale sucrée. Très rafraîchissante et pétillante tout en étant savoureuse ! Une très bonne Pilsner de microbrasserie, ce qui est rare au Québec !

Ce qui semble être une blonde quelconque se transforme en une savoureuse lager de type allemande, mais avec une tonne de goût et des notes habituellement étrangères aux blondes sans visage : notes de pin, amertume voisine dune pale ale, sucres costauds mais qui aident à arrondir la Kellerbier. Une franche réussite.

Trouble, avec une belle mousse et une dentelle enviable, cette bière affiche des teintes cuivrées avant de laisser percer un strident cri houblonné. En bouche, cest herbal (presque sapiné) avant même que lamertume ne  prenne le dessus. Zwickel/Keller/Landbier? Personnellement, je conseille cette bière aux amateurs de pilsner et de bitter anglaises. Un autre excellent produit signé LTM!

This bottled brew from rbsg #34 poured a small sized head of foamy fine to medium sized white colored bubbles that were mostly lasting and left behind a no visible carbonation hazy dark orange colored body. The mild aroma was malty and hot. The mouth feel was tingly at the start with a mellow finish with a mellow hoppy aftertaste. The flavor contained notes of rye wood dough and malt. A decent one that I would consider drinking again.
Bouteille de 341ml, robe blonde tranparente, arôme de houblons frais, goût de malt et de houblons citronnés, jai adoré!

d une couleur rouge et  d une col blanc. il y une explosion d houblons resineux et en bouche aussi avec beaucoup d amertume pour tout amateur de houblons moi j aime un peu moins  mais beaucoup de saveur

750ml bottle (corked and wired) into pilsner glass. Appears slightly hazy deep amber with a huge fluffy white head. I get strong notes of orange peel on the nose with grainy malts and soft floral and leafy elements. Palate is medium bodied with the malt sweetness nicely balanced by the hop and yeast presence. I was reminded of a Tripel Karmerliet from Belgium when tasting this but it has a lower ABV and is more quaffable and drier in the finish.
Pours cloudy orange with a generous helping of frothy white head. Aroma is spicy sweet. Flavour is full of saison clove and yeast flavours and pilsener bitterness
750 mL from Broue Ha Ha.  Faintly reddish and opaque, with an aroma to savour.  Tastes like a passionate tryst with the gorgeous Constance Bonacieux.

Corked and caged 750 ml bottle. Pours a clear copper color with a large white head. A sweet nose of biscuit and dusty leaves. A rich robust flavor with light bitter hops, metal, some caramel, light earthy malts. Very smooth and nice. Again, the amount of info on the back label is amazing.

375ml bottle. Ruby tinged amber with a biege head that fades to a nice ring around the glass. Fresh biscuit, caramel, malt, bit of corn, mild. Moderate body and carbonation, slightly sweet and doughy, becomes a bit dry and bitter on the finish with more malt and some biscuit.

Very fluffy white head, lots of carbonation. Pale straw, slightly cloudy from the yeast. Taste is very noble hops floral, some spicy notes. I cant help but think that this would be even better without the yeast in the bottle.. may be not filtered but on tap, without the bottle sediments, it must be truly amazing.

Bottle, purchased at Depanneur Peluso - Montreal, QC. Breezy warm summer air, full of grasses, heat, and almond skins. This takes a little warming and little time to spread its textured Continental malt characters and bristly lupulin over the tongue. Fresh and delicious. Cashews meld with apricots and other pale, seasonal Mediterrean delights, like herbal thoughts of sage and tarragon. The hops give a surprisingly prickly edge to the softer, more accomodating tones of the malt build.

i could copy other ratebierians that i respect and put out a solid review.i do not want to do that,but i do want to say that my level of understanding of how beer is made does not let me do justice to a complete review.
what i can say is this beer was delicious.i think it was one of the top 25 beers that i ever had.i am sorry that i only bought one bottle(bought/carried 10 news beers from the store that day).
i can not wait to try this again!

Bouteille 750ml. Couleur orangée un peu trouble, mousse blanche crèmeuse, laissant une belle dentelle. Bulle assez fine. Arôme de citron, de miel, de houblon, un peu floral. Léger goût dagrumes, de miel avec une belle amertume en  fin de bouche.

Bottle. Different label (not green, more tan/brown). Amber beer with a cream head. Sweet malt and light honey aroma with light mineral notes. Malt and spice flavor with light grass. Medium bodied. Malt and psice lingers with light honey, light spice, and light grass.

On tap at Saint-Bock, Montreal.  Color is a bright amber with a minimal white head which reduces to just a ring.  Leaves almost no lacing.  Aroma is a mix of cereals/malt and is relatively herbal.  Bready, moderately bitter aftertaste with a moderately long finish.  Bitter "post-taste".  Medium body with average carbonation.  A nice Keller, nothing outstanding but I would drink this again, on a nice hot afternoon, just as Im doing now...!

C&C 750 mL bottle from State Line Liquors quite some time ago, opened 5/8/12. Pours a hazy amber color with a large frothy white head. Decent head retention. Aroma of bready malts, caramel, buttery and herbal notes. The taste is herbal notes, peppery notes, buttery notes, stone fruits, bread. Medium bodied and quite dry. Slight lingering bitterness and assertive carbonation. Interesting.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours hazy dark golden with low white head. Aroma is of citrus and malt. Taste is of citrus and malt. Good, refreshing, nicely balanced. Nothing outstanding though.

Bottle 750 ml. Pour dark orange with a nice lasting white head. Aroma: vegetables and cereales. Some corn in the taste. Light bitterness. Ok beer, not much to say about it.
Bouteille 750ml. Orange foncée avec un beau collet blanc persistant. Arômes: légumes et céréales. Un peu de maïs au goût. Légère amertume. Une bière correcte, pas grand chose à dire.

Bottle 750 ml. Pours yellow with orange reflects. Medium fluffy white head. Good carbonation. Aroma is herbal/floral/vegetable with some spices. Taste is grassy, with notes of spices and corn. Slight bitterness. Palate is creamy.

Poured from a corked 750 ml bottle. Appearance is a hazy copper to blond with a nice bit of white foam. Aroma is a bit musty with a biscuit malt influence. Taste is mild overall, with just a touch more sweetness than bitterness. Light body, spritzy carbonation.

Pours a cloudy rustic gold color with a puffy head that kind of dampens the aroma.  What I do get from the smell is some light noble hop type notes and some grass.  The taste throws me for a loop... Im getting a heavy dose of pepper along with a touch of hop zing.  Peppery.  Very cloudy.  Very unique and not unpleasant.  I dig this beer.

Refrigerated 750 mL bottle poured into a shaker.  Pours hazy golden with small off-white head.  Some lacing, medium body, medium carbonated, and light hop aroma.  Taste is light malty citrus and light bitter finish.  Based on rating expected a little more.
Bottle, pours a nice blond, the aroma is light the beer is full of flavour and has a bit of a harshness in the finish, overall quite nice

Pour is a hazy orange with a large white head.  Aroma is a very earthy grain with a nice lingering hop.  Flavor is sweet but dry bready malts with a nice hop following.  Probably even more hoppy then the style should be but stll a decent drinking beer.  A bit expensive (this does not need to be is a caged and corked bottle) but this is a nice new world example of the style.

750 mL bottle. 

Pours a cloudy golden-orange with a large, white head. The nose is sweet and fruity up front, with red apple, peach, banana, and citrus. There is also a good dose of yeast funk, and some pleasant musty/earthy/vegetal/phenolic aromas. Mouth feel is full with medium carbonation. The taste is very earthy and musty with grassy hops, hay-like aromas, and biscuity malts, as well as sour apple cider, lemon, orange-peel, berries, and pureed fruit salad. There is a nice tartness to it all with just enough sweetness to balance it out. Finishes dry and fruity leaving citrus peel, and bitter hops. Very, very enjoyable.

Bière blonde dapparence trouble chapeautée dune mousse franche et durable. Arômes de malt et comme dautres bières de leur série Signature, ça sent agréablement sucré: le miel de trèfle, la pâte à pain, la levure ou encore la fermentation. En bouche, ça me rappelle une bière de type saison, je perçois des herbes fraîches diverses, un bouquet dépices, la cardamome, le tout accompagné dune touche légèrement acidulée qui reste en arrière-goût. 
Souvent, jai passé à côté de cette bière, parce que cest étiqueté comme étant une pilsner, non-filtrée, mais étant donné que ce nest pas un type que jaffectionne particulièrement, je la boudais. On peut dire que je suis agréablement surpris par cette découverte. (192-200312)
Probablement une bouteille défectueuse... On goûte un peu de miel de trèfle mais cest avant tout une forme damertume et de métal qui domine...

750 ml bottle. Pours a golden, veiled pale orange  with a thick, persistent white head. Smells of grains and floral hops. Tastes like sweet corn, grains and barley with a sharp, obvious pilsner-esque bitterness. Full-bodied, creamy, frothy. Good, although not fabulous. I was a bit disappointed, as I did not feel like this beer was on par with most of Les Trois Mousquetaires Série Signatures. Made for an okay aperitif, though.

Bottle.  I was very disappointed with this beer as I only tasted a bitterness and I was expecting something maybe fruity, dry, spicy and/or floral.  It might be what it should be or I might have a bad bottle but this one reminded me of a British IPA.

Pours a deep golden color with a nice frothy white head that leaves quite a bit of lacing. Musty aromas of malt, bread, and spices. Flavors of citrus, malt and spices. Crisp and clean finish. Light-medium body. Very refreshing. I liked this beer a lot.

En arôme, la banane, la pomme et les houblons nobles sont bien fusionné. En bouche cest vivant avec les esters de levure bien intégré au confort malté. Une amertume terreuse se manifeste progressivement pour finalement sinstaller en permanence. Plus elle se réchauffe, plus la présence du clou de girofle est évidente. Excellente buvabilité combiné à une agréable robustesse.
Copper colour. medium carbonation with a frothy white head. Lace clings to glass. Malt, spice with a hint of citrus and hop. Very refreshing and crisp. Tangy flavour with a malt backbone. Very nice.
bottle... sounds like it has train wreck written all over it but this is a really solid pilsner style beer, very flavorful, balanced hoppy with floral notes

Bottle, 
this beer had a orange pour with some red-amber color at the sides of the glass, there was a faint haze, and the pour gave a two to three finger head of white and faint off-white bubbles, this beer looks like a IPA, effervescence was lively, there were spots and fingers of lacing on the glass, and I found a loose, thin layer of brown sediment on the bottom of the bottle, 

the aroma was big bread malt with fruit, floral, nectar sweet hops, faint toasted malt, bread and orange fruit candy like sweetness, a little dust, 
hops were pretty dominate on the nose, there were earth/cellar scents that were interesting and probably the best, pronounced earth/cellar scent I had come across so far, 

the flavors were bread malt, orange citrus, hop bitterness was gentle with a touch of herb, and some earth hints, 
the finish had a gentle hop bitterness and offered some dryness on the palate, 

the mouth feel was less than medium with gentle carbonation, and it had a nice creamy feel on the palate, 

I enjoyed this beer so much, I wanted to go out and buy more bottles, a beer with a great nose and flavor.
#1036 bottle; Nose is heavy mold, sweet apple, celery, leaves, feel is mediumbroad, carb is medium, taste Is sweet grass, bitter lemon, rosehip, later little bile

Looks the part; Cloudy, opaque orange body with a dense and lasting, creamy off-white crown that leaves a fine web of lace. Piney, woody, nutty burst at first before drowning fruit and candy notes come through. Hints at fairy floss, toasted pinenuts, vine clippings, guava and peardrops, lychee and Chinese artificial candy, some overripe Honeydew and just a touch of vanilla. Quite a complex nose to marry a hop driven palate. Inside its creamy, a light pocket of spritzy carbonation upfront before a soft, smooth finish. The hops are in high gear giving it a rough, herbaceous and woody edge. The swallow assertively bitter with a clean piney drop off. Light malt sweetness upfront with a little toasted grain showing mid-palate, quite gritty, barnyardy. The body relatively light, yet rounded. It out weighs and out punches its meagre 5.5% ABV, giving the impression of a far stronger beer. There is even a touch of hot alcohol in the swallow (?) that sits flush with the hefty flavours. Drawn citrus fruit like tangelo and blood orange, and hints of peach build as it goes giving it a freshness. This is a lipsmacker that I cant quite pigeonhole. A strange Keller, but a good one! (75cL corked, no date stamp, Cellarbrations Carlisle)

Cclear brew amber colour.
Belgian yeasty, nutmeg anf ketchup chip note.
Med bodied but flavour full
bready

Une odeur de houblon florale fort alléchante. 
La robe est doré virant sur le orange, brumeuse (non filtré) et mystérieuse.  
Co2 moyen à élevé, amertume tranchante et franche.  Rien de compliqué mais diablement efficace.  10/12
Arrière goût costaud de houblon (amer).  Très plaisant.  5/6
Dans le registre amer, cest une bière franche et satisfaisante.

750ml bottle. Pours a clear, bright amber with a fluffy near white head that has medium retention. A little hoppy on the nose with a big candi sugar feel. Theres a spicy note there too. More interesting on the palate with a nice bitterness. The candi sugar comes and goes across the middle and that spicy kick flows all the way through. A little astringent on the palate.

What a beer!!!! The pour is a bright copperish orange with a thick foamy yellowish head. Leaves some thick sticky lacing. The nose is yeasty with a big spice note and a nice grassy German hop. The malts are quite low in the nose with a light toasty caramel and Munich malt. The taste is awesome with a sweet caramel malt in the middle and a big yeast and hop finish. Nice citrus fruit and a big spice of coriander and cloves (and a hint of pepper I think). The hops are mild but tasty on the finish. A nice dry and bitter aftertaste. Body is medium to full with a sticky taste. Overall, this beer is absolutely perfect.

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2013 pours bright golden, slight haze, with a towering white head, good retention and strong lacing. grainy, bready, loads of malts, dusty, hint of malt sweetness, sweet grass. moderate carbonation, medium to full body, medium to long grapefruity finish. excellent!
750ml bottle shared with user kevinsenn. Fruity and hoppy, with a nice bitter aftertaste. Has an mild, citrusy aroma and easy to drink. Very delicious.

750mL bottle from Broue Ha Ha.  Pours hazy orange.  Aroma has oranges, spices, and yeast.  Taste is very complex - orange, grapefruit, some spices, and a smokey yeast flavour, and a bitter aftertaste.  A nice beer.
Bouteille 750 ml. 5.5%. Couleur jaune foncé, mousse blanche épaisse. Arôme dagrumes, levures. Goût dagrumes, houblon, malt. Finale avec une fine amertume et céréale. Très bonne.

750mL corked bottle poured a pale amber color with modest white head settling quickly to some fine lacing.  Aromas of grain and some fresh hops.  Taste is bitter all the way through to the finish with some underlying graininess.  A light to medium body and some decent carbonation gives a nice mouthfeel.  Overall, a pretty nice beer for this style.

Dusty yeasty sweet bready and grassy nose. Pours unfiltered orange amber, big frothy head and lace. The flavor is a lot of sweet grass, bread, hints of caramel, and a nice dusty yeast characteristic. Lots of sweet grass in this one. Nice lively carbonation.
Hazy deep blonde with a good collar. Subtile aromas of hop and fruits. A little unbalanced.

Sampled at the GCBF 2010. Flowery german hops.
Cloudy orange, white head.
Dry yeast, pronounced grassy, citric hops balanced to that side.. Good body. Nice North-American interpretation.

Best pils by a long shot. Pours a very rich amber with a fairly solid and fluffy white head. Aroma is rather sweet. Spicey hops, some lemon and apple in there. Flavour brings out some grassy hops with a mild malt backing. This is a very good brew

Bière couleur dor un peu trouble sous un col immaculé, mais éphémère.  Des arômes de grenier poussiéreux avec un houblon herbacé.  Un goût bien équilibré dégageant une franche amertume.  Une bière agréablement lisse avec une effervescence animée.  Longue amertume en bouche.

This is the fifth beer in the LTM signature series that I have tried. Some have been average but this and the American Pale Ale are excellent. Very crisp Pils taste with a steady bitterness right from the beginning (unlike the APA in which the bitterness is more in the aftertaste). It is nice to drink an unfiltered pils style beer.
Bottle. Golden yellowish orange with a crisp light head.  grains, biscuit and malt in the nose. A complex and well modied mouth feel with sweet malts, an a pleasent balance of hops. its a great brew.
Bottle. Pours muddy gold. Nose of grain, barley, baked bread, yeast, confectioners sugar, flour and tangerine. Taste is very bready, lots of grain, yeast, malt and flour.
Very hoppy and grassy hop nose, with a bit of lemon and fresh cut flowers. The taste is a bit sweet, lots of hops-- grass, and just a bit vegetal. Still pretty solid.

750ml bottle. pours a slightly cloudy orange yellow with a monstrous fluffy white head that leaves enourmous amounts of lacing. aroma is resin and floral hops. taste has an earthy tone to it. bread and cereals is where it starts, and bitter hops is where it ends. medium bodied, lots of carbonation. a very refreshing beer.

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2010 Tasted from a 750 mL bottle purchased in Fort Collins, Colorado.  Hazy orange appearance similar to a Belgian ale or a Witbier.  Sweet yeasty head, full of flavor.  Flavor is yeasty,  sweet, somewhat hoppy, and surprisingly bitter.  Finish is bitter.  This kellerbier is way more hoppy and bitter than a German counterpart.

This completes my quest for all styles rated. Thanks again Kyle!!!!! Pours clear orange with a large foamy off white head that recedes leaving a nice layer of sticky froth. Aroma of spicy hops, hay, lemon, pils malt, apple, pretty crisp. Taste is nice as well, lots of grassy hops and light malt. Very good stuff. Light body, medium high carbonation.
Keg.  Fruity, spicy and light malt aroma.  Harsh bitterness, bitey.  Medium body, higher alcohol evident.
(Draught) Sampled at GCBF 2010 on September 10, 2010. Tart, tinny nose. Spiced hops to the max. Very fruity and hoppy flavour but the spice was too over-powering.

750 ml corked and caged bottle purchased at The Wine and Cheese Place in St Louis, Missouri.  Pour is hazed unfiltered golden orange with a big three inch white head that falls into loose foam. Some foamy lacing left behind. Aroma is toasted bready grain malt, along with a bright spiced yeast. Some straw and cilantro mixed in for good measure. Nice fresh nose. Taste is the hops up front, bright mineral and grassy spice, opening up into the toasted bread and grain of the nose. Finish is dry and the hops linger nicely. Palate is an unfitlered medium to light body, soft natural carbonation, drying out nicely in the finish. I generally enjoy the unfiltered lagers, and this was certainly no exception.

Very nice grassy hop profile blends with a quite brilliant crisp and sweet malt body.  This is a summer seasonal, so it shouldnt taste nearly as fresh as it does, and that makes it all the more impressive.  The kind of beer you can drink for days, this was great on a warm autumn day in Florida.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2013 unfiltered, bottle-conditioned lager. what a brilliant concept. heavily phenolic tart/sour pineapple and lemon-sprinkled sweet crackers. doughy, light, airy, pillowy, with saccharine sweetness. weirdly fun.
bottle shared on RBSG10 bus - nice lagery arouma. sticky caramel candy with some light hay and grass. weaty, groiny notes. Very well balanced.

Strong carbonation misty gold pour large fluffy head aromas floral herbal very pleasant on the nose spicy earthy flavours are spicy dry morishing hoppy fruit bitter strong tastes unfiltered this beer is full blown taste at its best nutty fizzy yet smooth honey great going down a killer of a keller finish superbly flavoured keller floral and hop fizz and bitter aftertaste very good

Bottle. Hazy gold with a large loose white head that collapses. High bead. Smells earthy and mildly spicy with a little bread. Taste has some pear and apple sweetness along with pils malt breadiness and sour undertone. Good fruit and peppery/ herbal bitterness. Rustic and fun.

BottleRBSG 2010 Cloudy golden lager with a small, creamy, white head. Great retention. The bouquet presents pale malts and white-peppery hops flanked by the slightest whiff of smoke. Light to medium-bodied and abrasive with laid-back carbonation. Medium bitter flavor  spicy grains and spicy hops. Coarse, dry finish.

Draught Moose & Mountie Spectapular, Sydney.
Hazy orange beer, dense white head.
Lively carbonation, smooth unfiltered texture.
Flavour and aroma are quite fruity, like dried apricot with floral grassy hops. Quite bitter, lingers for quite some time, almost mistaken for an APA at times.
Sample on the bus to Dark Horse during RBSG 10.  O... lord.   Super grassy plasticy aroma, overly sweet, messy.  Flavor follows, rotten grass, very sweet, rich, a kick in the throat, grainy.

Bottle sample thannks to my friends Erin and Chris- Pours a hazed orange with a frothy eggshell cap. Nose of orange zest, floral hops, grass, earth. Tastes very fresh and bright, of floral hops, citrus, earthy malts, light bitterness. Puckering bitter finish with nice earthy aftertaste. Good.
UPDATED: SEP 15, 2010 tap at taphouse. pours a cloudy bright yellow, with a small off white head. quite biscuity with some lemon flavour and aroma, finishing off with a slight bitterness.
Tap. Very interesting beer. Aromas of citrus, and pine. Taste has a sweet start, with sour notes, and a bitter finish. Palate is creamy, and medium bodied. Cloudy yellow, with a frothy white head.

Had this on the bus on the way to Dark Horse and Bells during RBSG.  Pours a hazed gold with a medium sized white head.  Soft hoppy citrus and big grain.  Somewhat floral.  Smooth and soft, sweet and crisp.  Subtle and tasty, big grainy finish.

Pours a hazy golden with a perfect medium white head that keeps a perfect retention and leaves a good lace. The aroma is grainy with lots of wet grain and as much fresh hay as I could ever ask for in a beer. The flavor is nicely hoppy in an earthy delicate way with a good grainy note and some bitter citrus rind. This beer is rustic, simple, and absolutely delicious.

hazy golden color, very earthy nose full of continental hops and malts. Mouth starts malty, with notes of hay, straw, grass and earth. Then the hops jump in with a long lingering bitter finish. Very authentic. True to style. Wish more breweries in N America could produce something so authentic. Superb.
Bottle.  Cloudy yellow pour, white head.  Bread, citrus, slightly earthy. Its alright, drinkable, but not too exciting.

The initial smell from this reminds me, slightly, of the blue chemicals in port-a-potties. And it smells like generic beer under that. I take that back, Im trying to give it credit but under that it acutlaly smells like cheap generic beer. It looks great though, pours with a nice head, very lovely hazy orangy golden colour, good lacing too. Its quite clean tasting, you dont notice the flavours until the yeast comes on, then its sweetish but theres a strange aftertaste thats sort of bitter, but not a good hop bitter, just ugly mouth bitter nastiness. What the hell, I thought this was supposed to cleanse my palate between bites of fine food, not foul up my palet... Im just not getting this beer, its not sinking in, its not warming up, its just a weird nastiness in my mouth that looks fantastic in a glass. The juxtaposition of flavours in this remind me of peasant food for thin times when you have to make do with what you have cuz the regular ingredients are out, and your poor anyways. But damn does it look good in my glass.

Slight hazy gold blonde, tall dense white head. Classic Keller aromas - bready, earthy plus slight zing of alco and yeast. Taste is earthy and leafy with good bitter hops and grapes and pale tree fruit.  Light spice, great feel and balance.

Le liquide apparaît doré et on observe une mousse solide et persistante.  Présence de traces collantes sur le verre.  Au nez, principalement des céréales sucrées, du pain frais, des houblons aux notes dagrumes et des fleurs.  Au goût, le liquide offre des grains maltées qui se combinent avec une amertume assez franche.  Finale sèche pour ce liquide légèrement poivré qui laisse de longues et agréables morsures sur la langue.

Pours hazed bright yellow, off white head.  Bready nose, some biscuit and butter, maybe a little lemony twang around the edges.  Bready/biscuity flavgors with a pretty sharp bitter edge...really sharp actually.  Nothing overly refined though...but clean enough and interestingly aggressive with its bitterness.

Bottle. Large white head on a hazy orange body. The head dissipates to a patchy film. A good amount of lacing left behind. Nose has bready malt, some fruitiness, earthy noble hops. Flavors of bread grain, light toast, honey, lemony citrus, spicy, peppery bitterness. Body is medium and on the thin side. Finish is clean and bitter. Nicely done.

Mondial de la bière Montréal 2010 
Aroma soft aromatic nose with great hop profile. Very refreshing.
 Appearance  amber hazed  look with mid creamy top.
Flavor and Palate : quiet bitter , citric hop oriented brew. Soft malt was shown but sadly felt bit understated. This could be even better if it was not so one dimensional.

750ml Bottle:  Aroma of malt, bread, herbs, and a hint of bread.  Poured amber in color with a medium-sized, creamy, dense, off-white head that diminished but lasted throughout.  Cloudy.  Very sparkling.  Excellent lacing.  Flavor is slightly sweet and lightly bitter.  Tastes of herbs, grain, malt, light bread, light hops, and yeast.  Medium body.  Slick, then slightly dry texture.  Average carbonation. Malt, grain, herb, and slight bread finish.  Quite boring, but also quite drinkable.

750 mL bottle from Depanneur Peluso.  Gold with a nice white head and good lacing.  Not as hazy as Id expect from the style.  Very appealing grainy, noble-hopped aroma.  This one is hugely full of flavour, for a lager, with hay and sunflower seeds from the malt and cough syrup, and herbs from the hops.  Crisp.  Excellent.

750ml bottle. Very lightly hazy golden/orange.  with a thick foamy off-white head with good retention and beautiful lacing. Aroma is herbal hops with floral notes, malt and a hint of spices. Flavor is herbal and floral hops, bitterness, malt, some sugar, yeast and moderate astrigency with an heavy bitter finish. Medium body with lively carbonation.

Great beer! Poured with a nice off white foamy frothy head and good lace. Color is a hazy amber. Aroma is a wonderful spice yeast malt . Flavors like aroma and richer. Body is great and so is carbonation. Finish is like flavor and of short length. Definitely a session beer.

750ml Bottle from Premier.  Pours a hazy orange with a nice white head.  Nose is grassy hop up front with some lemon/orange zest notes.  Nice doughy malt and a little bit of cork, some alcohol.  Flavor is grassy hops, a really nice toasty/buscuity malt.  Some citrus pith and bitter to the point of being astringent.  Bitter orange extract finish and definite tannin character.  Body is great, except in the finish where it ends up too sharp.
Bottle, pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of pale malts, yeast, sweetness and lemony. Flavour has a lemon tang, yeast, some hops, grains, with a bitter finish.

Hazy orange-gold pour with a huge foamy head.
Aroma was light yeast and fresh smelling grainy almost lemony tones.
Flavour is yeasty and peppery, some earthy funk over a bready dryish malt body. Slightly grassy hop bitterness in the finish.

Name: Kellerbier
Date: April 14, 2010
Mode: Bottle
Source: Knightly Spirits, Orlando
Appearance: hazy orange, frothy beige head, sudsy lace
Aroma: sweet malty aroma, nice breadyness, light spicyness, touch of fruityness
Flavor: sweet malt flavor, fruity sweetness, nice breadyness, floral hops, balancing earthyness, touch of spicyness, light lingering bitter finish
